metadata.synopsis: Avatar laezel contemplates everything that happened with Vlaakith at the creche.For cine context, reuse from CAMP_FirstNight_AvD - just laying in bed, thinking.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Becomes available as a camp night as soon as the Creche Vlaakith encounter is finished.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *'I know a secret that Vlaakith never wants to be revealed.'*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *What secret could be so ruinous to the Undying Queen of the Six Arms of Tu'narath?*

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: This secret is not yours to know. You will return the Astral Prism to Vlaakith and regain her favour.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *But even in reverie, doubt gnaws at you like a tadpole at its host.*

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: There's no telling - but your people have turned on you. Vlaakith is afraid of being found out.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *As a young warrior on K'liir, you devoted your life to your queen.*

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *You were taught that she would reward her most vicious adepts with ascension - an invitation to the imperial city of Tu'narath.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Now, doubt gnaws at you like a tadpole at its host.*

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Your people seek your head, just as the dream figure warned. Whatever this secret, Vlaakith will kill her own faithful to keep it.*

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: Lies, every word of it. Ghaik trickery played on you by the parasite in your head.

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *'Queen Vlaakith is lying to you and your people.'*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *These were the words of your dream figure. Not long ago, they pierced the ethereal stillness of the Astral Plane.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Blasphemous words, looming as large in your mind as the towering figure of Vlaakith herself.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Could the Undying Queen truly be powerless against the Illithid Empire, as the dream figure said?*

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: Heresy. Your queen bears the might of the Astral Sea. The ghaik are no threat to the githyanki.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Your mind bursts with vicious images of githyanki knights tearing through scores of mind flayers.*

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *Silver swords stained with shimmering ghaik blood - a comforting notion. Your queen is eternal and your people untouchable.*

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: If the figure holds the power to resist illithid control, you must return it to Vlaakith.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Such a feat would surely earn your queen's most gracious blessings.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *You would wield a silver sword, ride a red dragon of your own. You would not just be ascended - you would be kith'rak.*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *Yet even within reverie, the figure's final words penetrate as a silver sword into illithid flesh:*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *'You were on the right path - to Moonrise Towers. Return to it.'*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Moonrise is your destiny. That is where the truth will finally out.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *'You must go to Moonrise Towers. That is where the cultists are gathering.'*

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: This figure is protecting you from the Absolute. They are an ally - and worth hearing out.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *But now? Now, doubt gnaws at your skull like a tadpole gnaws at its host.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *If the ghaik empire should rise - if the Grand Design were to transpire - it could be the doom of your people.*

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: The zaith'isk failed. Your people have turned on you. There must be truth in the figure's words.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *As a young warrior on K'liir, you'd never once questioned your queen.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *Her words were carved in slate and her figure carved in granite. She was silver, she was iron, she was your reason for being.*

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *You gave her everything - yet she's turned your own people against you, just as the dream figure warned.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Vlaakith is afraid. Afraid of what you might discover. Afraid of you. And your most reliable ally lives inside the Prism you carry.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *The figure bid you to journey to Moonrise Towers. That is your destiny. That is where the truth will finally out.*

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Your people have turned on you. There must be truth in the figure's words.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: Lies, every word of it. Ghaik trickery played on you by the parasite in your head.

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *You breathe slowly and deeply, seeking refuge from the figure's deceit in the words of the sacred Tla'ket.*

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *'Vlaakith, show us truth. Vlaakith, make me pure. Vlaakith, I seek entry. Vlaakith, I am reborn.'*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *You did as the Undying Queen asked.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *You entered the Astral Prism. You attacked the one inside.*

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *Now your own people point their blades at you, Lae'zel of K'liir, Vlaakith's most faithful warrior - just as your dream figure warned.*

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: Return the Astral Prism to Vlaakith and regain her favour.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *But even in reverie, worry gnaws at you like a tadpole at its host.*

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *Whoever this dream figure, one thing is clear: Vlaakith would sacrifice her own faithful to slay them.*

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Look for a way back into the Prism and ask the dream figure what they know.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Questions gnaw at your mind like a tadpole at its host.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *What is this Astral Prism? Who is this dream figure? And what makes Vlaakith so desperate to slay them?*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *For now, the answers are locked tightly away. But there is one thing you are most certain of:*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *Vlaakith will stop at nothing to retrieve the Prism - even if it means sacrificing Lae'zel of K'liir, her most faithful champion.*

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: Find the zaith'isk inside the crèche and cleanse yourself of the parasite.

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *You want little more to rid yourself of the ghaik tadpole in your head.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *Vlaakith knows this too. Perhaps the zaith'isk will cleanse you - or perhaps the Undying Queen will see that it kills you.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *As long as you carry the Prism - and the one inside - you remain Vlaakith's prey.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Even faith is no shield when it's your own goddess who would shatter you.*

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: Do what you do best: fight. Bleed your own people if they come for your head.

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *It was in Vlaakith's name that you learned the art of the blade. It was by her protocol that you sought purification.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *You can carry yourself tall knowing you were loyal in both deed and intent. You are no heretic.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Let Vlaakith's servants come for you if they dare. You will show them who embodies the true essence of the githyanki.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *And come, they most certainly will. Whoever this dream figure, Vlaakith would clearly sacrifice her own faithful to slay them.*
